sen.j: 長浜びわこ大仏（ながはまびわこだいぶつ）は、滋賀県長浜市の平安山良畴寺にある大仏である。
sen.e: Nagahama Biwako Daibutsu (Great Buddha of Nagahama Biwako) is the Great Buddha at the Heiansan Ryochu-ji Temple in the Nagahama City, Shiga Prefecture.
Nagahama Biwako Daibutsu (Great Buddha of Nagahama Biwako) is the statue of Buddha in Ryochu-ji Temple on Mt. Heian in Nagahama City, Shiga Prefecture.
Nagahama Biwako Daibutsu (Great Buddha of Nagahama Biwako) is the statue of Buddha in Ryochu-ji Temple on Mt. Heian in Nagahama City, Shiga Prefecture.

sen.j: 現在のは2代目である。
sen.e: The present statue is the second.
The present statue is the second.
The present statue is the second.

sen.j: 琵琶湖大仏、びわこ大仏ともいう。
sen.e: It is also called Biwako Daibutsu.
It is also called Biwako Daibutsu.
It is also called Biwako Daibutsu.

sen.j: 阿弥陀如来立像の大仏。
sen.e: The Great Buddha of standing statue of Amida Nyorai (Amitabha Tathagata).
It is a standing statue of Amida Nyorai (Amitabha Tathagata).
It is a standing statue of Amida Nyorai (Amitabha Tathagata).

sen.j: 像高28m、青銅製。
sen.e: It is 28m high and made of bronze.
It is twenty-eight meters in height and made of bronze.
It is twenty-eight meters in height and made of bronze.

sen.j: 初代の名は護国阿弥陀如来。
sen.e: The name of the first generation was Gokoku Amida Nyorai.
The name of the first generation was Gokoku Amida Nyorai.
The name of the first generation was Gokoku Amida Nyorai.

sen.j: 2代目より長浜びわこ大仏と名づけられている。
sen.e: The second generation was named Nagahama Biwako Daibutsu.
The second generation was named Nagahama Biwako Daibutsu.
The second generation was named Nagahama Biwako Daibutsu.

sen.j: 滋賀県長浜市下浜坂町86
sen.e: 86 Shimohamasaka-cho, Nagahama City, Shiga Prefecture
86 Shimohamasaka-cho, Nagahama City, Shiga Prefecture
86 Shimohamasaka-cho, Nagahama City, Shiga Prefecture

sen.j: コンクリート製の阿弥陀如来立像。
sen.e: A concrete standing statue of Amida Nyorai
It is a standing statue of Amida Nyorai and made of concrete.
It is a standing statue of Amida Nyorai and made of concrete.

sen.j: 高さ27m。
sen.e: It is 27m high.
It is twenty-seven meters in height.
It is twenty-seven meters in height.

sen.j: 1933年（昭和8年）1月：平安山良畴寺の三十世義天和尚が発願。
sen.e: In January 1933: The 30th Giten Osho (high priest) of the Heiansan Ryochu-ji Temple proposed to build it.
January 1933: The 30th head priest of Ryochu-ji Temple on Mt. Heian, Giten Osho proposed to build it.
January 1933: The 30th head priest of Ryochu-ji Temple on Mt. Heian, Giten Osho proposed to build it.
In April 1937: It was built.
In April 1937: It was built.
In April 1937: It was built.

sen.j: 開眼供養。
sen.e: A ceremony to consecrate a newly made Buddhist statue or image by inserting the eyes (thereby investing it with soul) was held.
A ceremony to consecrate a newly made Buddhist statue or image by inserting the eyes (thereby investing it with soul) was held.
A ceremony to consecrate a newly made Buddhist statue or image by inserting the eyes (thereby investing it with soul) was held.

sen.j: ｢護国阿弥陀如来｣と名づけられる。
sen.e: It was named 'Gokoku Amida Nyorai.'
It was named 'Gokoku Amida Nyorai.'
It was named 'Gokoku Amida Nyorai.'

sen.j: 1981年（昭和56年）：老朽化の為、再建が決定する。
sen.e: In 1981: It was determined to be rebuilt because of aging.
In 1981: It was determined to be rebuilt because of aging.
In 1981: It was determined to be rebuilt because of aging.

sen.j: 1992年（平成4年）3月：解体。
sen.e: In March 1992: It was scrapped.
In March 1992: It was scrapped.
In March 1992: It was scrapped.

sen.j: 解体された後、その残骸は境内に埋められ、供養塔が建っている。
sen.e: After it was scrapped, the debris was buried in precincts and the memorial tower was built.
After it was scrapped, the debris was buried in precincts and the memorial tower was built.
After it was scrapped, the debris was buried in precincts and the memorial tower was built.

sen.j: 1981年（昭和56年）：建立が決定する。
sen.e: In 1981: It was determined to be built.
In 1981: It was determined to be built.
In 1981: It was determined to be built.

sen.j: 1994年（平成6年）：建立。
sen.e: In 1994: It was built.
In 1994: It was built.
In 1994: It was built.

sen.j: 開眼供養。
sen.e: A ceremony to consecrate a newly made Buddhist statue or image by inserting the eyes was held.
A ceremony to consecrate a newly made Buddhist statue or image by inserting the eyes was held.
A ceremony to consecrate a newly made Buddhist statue or image by inserting the eyes was held.

sen.j: 北陸本線長浜駅下車。
sen.e: Get off at the Nagahama Station of Hokuriku Main Line.
Get off at the Nagahama Station of Hokuriku Main Line.
Get off at the Nagahama Station of Hokuriku Main Line.

sen.j: 琵琶湖沿いに南下徒歩25分。
sen.e: Walk for 25 minutes to south along Lake Biwa.
Walk for 25 minutes to south along Lake Biwa.
Walk for 25 minutes to south along Lake Biwa.

sen.j: 北陸本線田村駅下車。
sen.e: Get off at the Tamura Station of Hokuriku Main Line.
Get off at the Tamura Station of Hokuriku Main Line.
Get off at the Tamura Station of Hokuriku Main Line.

sen.j: 琵琶湖沿いに北上徒歩30分。
sen.e: Walk for 25 minutes to north along Lake Biwa.
Walk for 30 minutes to north along Lake Biwa.
Walk for 30 minutes to north along Lake Biwa.
